revision.comment: Updated caps for the mighty villa

{{Use dmy dates|date=September 2014}} {{Use British English|date=September 2014}} {{Infobox football biography | name=Kortney Hause | image=Kortney_Hause_2014-02-06_17-58.jpg | caption=Hause playing for Wycombe in 2014 | fullname=Kortney Paul Duncan Hause{{cite web |title=EFL: Club list of registered players |url=https://www.efl.com/siteassets/efl-documents/efl-released-and-retained-list---2016-17.pdf |publisher=English Football League |format=PDF |page=41 |date=20 May 2017 |accessdate=6 October 2017}} | birth_date={{birth date and age|1995|7|16|df=y}}{{cite web |title=Kortney Hause |url=https://www.11v11.com/players/kortney-hause-239802/ |work=11v11.com |publisher=AFS Enterprises |accessdate=6 October 2017}} | birth_place=[[Goodmayes]], England | height={{height|m=1.89}} | currentclub=[[Aston Villa F.C|Aston Villa]]
(on loan from [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]]) | clubnumber=30 | position=[[Defender (association football)|Centre back]] | youthyears1= | youthyears2=2003–2011 | youthyears3=2011–2012 | youthyears4=2012 | youthclubs1=Lakeview | youthclubs2=[[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] | youthclubs3=[[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] | youthclubs4=[[Wycombe Wanderers F.C.|Wycombe Wanderers]] | years1 = 2012–2014 | clubs1 = [[Wycombe Wanderers F.C.|Wycombe Wanderers]] | caps1 = 23 | goals1 = 2 | years2 = 2014– | clubs2 = [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] | caps2 = 67 | goals2 = 2 | years3 = 2014 | clubs3 = → [[Gillingham F.C.|Gillingham]] (loan) | caps3 = 14 | goals3 = 1 | years4 = 2019– | clubs4 = → [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] (loan) | caps4 = 4 | goals4 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2014–2015 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] | nationalcaps1 = 9 | nationalgoals1 = 2 | nationalyears2 = 2015–2017 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps2 = 10 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | club-update = 16:37, 22 January 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 22:40, 30 June 2017 (UTC) }} '''Kortney Paul Duncan Hause''' (born 16 July 1995) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)|centre back]] for [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]], on loan from [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]]. He was a regular for both [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] and [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] sides and played in [[Gareth Southgate]]'s victorious [[2016 Toulon Tournament]] side. ==Club Career== ===Early career=== Hause was released by [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham]] at sixteen having joined the club's academy at a young age from his local side Lakeview F.C.. He had been a regular for West Ham's under-16s, including taking part in a tour of [[Bermuda]] in 2010.{{cite web | url=http://www.whufc.com/articles/20100215/hammers-end-well-in-bermuda_2236884_1967197 | publisher=West Ham United F.C | title=Hammers end well in Bermuda | date=15 February 2010 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140201194544/http://www.whufc.com/articles/20100215/hammers-end-well-in-bermuda_2236884_1967197 | archivedate=1 February 2014 | df=dmy-all }} He went on to sign for [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] as a scholar following his release, joining alongside fellow West Ham youngster [[Charlee Adams]] in late 2011.{{cite web |title=Hause heads to Wolves |url=https://www.wycombewanderers.co.uk/news/2014/january/hause-heads-to-wolves/ |website=[[Wycombe Wanderers F.C.]] |accessdate=8 January 2019}}{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/~/media/Files/TheFAPortal/governance-docs/registrations/july-2011.ashx |title=List of Players Registered as Scholars in Accordance with Rule C.3 Between 01/07/2011 and 31/07/2011 |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=10 January 2014}}{{cite web |url=http://www.lfe.org.uk/blog/joining-the-blues-pre-season-part-1 |title=Joining The Blues: Pre-season Part 1 |first=Charlee |last=Adams |publisher=League Football Education |date=4 November 2011 |accessdate=10 January 2014}} ===Wycombe Wanderers=== Having spent only a few months at Birmingham, Hause signed youth team forms with [[Wycombe Wanderers F.C.|Wycombe Wanderers]] in February 2012. He signed his first professional contract for Wycombe only a few months after signing youth forms in July 2012.{{cite web| url=http://www.football-league.co.uk/league2/news/20120703/chairboys-hand-out-pro-deals_2293326_2830505| publisher=Football League | title=Chairboys hand out pro deals|date=3 July 2012}} He went on to make his professional debut on 3 November 2012, coming on as a substitute in a 4–1 defeat to [[Crewe Alexandra F.C.|Crewe Alexandra]] in the [[FA Cup]].{{cite web| url=http://www.wycombewanderers.co.uk/news/article/winfield-hause-has-great-potential-468240.aspx| publisher=Wycombe Wanderers F.C| title=Winfield: Hause has great potential|date=5 November 2013}} During the 2013–14 season he became a regular player for Wycombe until suffering an ankle fracture in November 2013.{{cite web| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24993756| publisher=BBC Sport| title=Kortney Hause: Wycombe Wanderers defender fractures ankle|date=18 November 2013}} ===Wolverhampton Wanderers=== On 31 January 2014 he signed for [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] in a {{frac|2|1|2}}-year deal for an undisclosed fee.{{cite web| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25992938| publisher=BBC Sport| title=Wolves sign Wycombe's Kortney Hause|date=31 January 2014}} In July 2014 Wolves agreed to loan Hause to [[Football League One|League One]] club [[Gillingham F.C.|Gillingham]] until January 2015.{{cite web| url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28527777| publisher=BBC Sport| title=Kortney Hause: Gillingham sign Wolves defender on loan|date=28 July 2014}} He scored his first goal for Gillingham in a 2-2 draw with [[Swindon Town]] on 19 August 2014.{{cite web |url=http://www.kentonline.co.uk/medway/sport/gills-v-swindon-22149/|title=Gillingham 2 Swindon Town 2 - match report |publisher=kentonline.co.uk |date=19 August 2014 |accessdate=13 January 2018}} However, his loan was cut short in November 2014 when he was recalled by Wolves after having made 17 appearances in total for the Gills.{{cite web| url=http://www.wolves.co.uk/news/article/hause-coming-home-2101653.aspx| publisher=Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C| title=Hause coming home| date=28 November 2014| deadurl=yes| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141125212202/http://www.wolves.co.uk/news/article/hause-coming-home-2101653.aspx| archivedate=25 November 2014| df=dmy-all}} He made his Wolves debut on 13 December 2014 in a 1–0 win at [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]].{{cite web| url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30356810| publisher=BBC Sport| title=Sheffield Wednesday 0–1 Wolves|date=13 December 2014}} After the departure of [[Richard Stearman]] to [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]],{{cite web|url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2015/september/01/stearman-signs|title=Stearman Signs - Fulham Football Club|website=Fulhamfc.com|accessdate=17 December 2017}} Hause became a main part in the Wolves defense. On 24 October 2015, in a 1–3 loss to [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]], he suffered a torn hamstring that ruled him out for at least 6 weeks.{{cite web|url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/2015/10/27/wolves-dealt-injury-blow-with-defender-kortney-hause-out-for-up-to-six-weeks/|title=Wolves dealt injury blow with defender Kortney Hause out for up to six weeks|website=Expressandstar.com|accessdate=17 December 2017}} He scored his first goal for Wolves against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] on 10 December 2016.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38192220 |title=Wolves 4-4 Fulham |publisher=BBC |date=10 December 2016 |accessdate=12 December 2016}} Having signed a three-year contract in April 2018 Hause is signed to Wolves until summer 2021.{{cite web| url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/43654776| publisher=BBC Sport| title=Kortney Hause: Wolves defender signs new three-year contract|date=5 April 2018}} On 7 January 2019, Hause signed for [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] on loan until the end of the season with an option of a permanent transfer.{{cite web|url=https://www.avfc.co.uk/News/2019/01/07/transfer-news-korney-hause-joins-on-loan| publisher=avfc.co.uk| title=Kortney Hause joins on loan|date=7 January 2019}} ==International Career== Hause was a regular [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] and [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] international and played in [[Gareth Southgate]]'s victorious [[2016 Toulon Tournament]] side, including starting in the final against France in a 2-1 victory.{{cite web |title=England Under-21s win Toulon Tournament for first time in 22 years |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36410296 |website=[[BBC Sport]] |publisher=[[BBC]] |accessdate=8 January 2019}} ==Personal life== Hause is a [[grime (music)|grime]] [[Rapping|rapper]] in his time away from football, using the alias ''Korts''.{{Citation|last=GRM Daily|title=Alpha ft. Korts - Cheques [Music Video] {{!}} GRM Daily|date=2017-07-19|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kdrqCJSkh_s|accessdate=2017-07-20}}{{cite web |last1=Choudry |first1=Nooruddean |title=Defender/rapper slammed by Liverpool fans...for praising Jordan Henderson |url=https://www.joe.co.uk/sport/defenderrapper-slammed-by-liverpool-fans-for-praising-jordan-henderson-139319 |website=Joe |accessdate=7 January 2019}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 12 January 2019}} {| class=wikitable style="text-align: center;" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan=2|Club
